image.altText: A person holding a mobile phone scrolling Facebook Marketplace.

props.synopsis: Savannah thought she had taken all the right steps to protect herself while selling items on Facebook Marketplace — but that didn't stop her from being scammed. Here's what you need to know when buying and selling via online marketplaces.

title.children: Facebook Marketplace and Gumtree is full of scammers. Here's how to avoid them

image.altText: A person scrapes bees from a board with a comb.

props.synopsis: A fast-spreading parasite is expected to devastate local bee colonies over the next two years, affecting commercial and backyard crops.

title.children: Half of Canberra's beehives could be wiped out in two years. Here's why

image.altText: helicopter hovering and emergency crews on a bush track

props.synopsis: A woman hiking on the NSW south coast survives being bitten twice by an eastern brown snake more than 2 metres long.

title.children: 'Incredibly lucky' bushwalker survives bite from giant brown snake

image.altText: A man works at his desk using video editing software

props.synopsis: Would those classic black-and-white films be the same if viewed in full colour?

title.children: Debate about colouring old films is not black and white

props.synopsis: As Australia and England clash in The Ashes cricket series, Australian War Memorial historians have uncovered two diaries that recount a cricket series played behind barbed wire in prisoner of war camps.

title.children: Cricket cartoons and a 'substitute' Ashes in AWM collection

image.altText: Reading 5

props.synopsis: There are books from authors that would become household names — F. Scott Fitzgerald and A.A Milne among them — and books that are now banned in some countries. But what can we learn from what people were reading in 1925?

title.children: What a 1925 summer reading list reveals about us

image.altText: The exterior of the law courts in the ACT

props.synopsis: A 39-year-old man has been remanded in custody after police allege he fired multiple shots at officers during a Christmas Eve incident in Canberra's north.

title.children: Man charged with assaulting pregnant woman, shooting at police

image.altText: A young man leaves court.

props.synopsis: An 18-year-old Canberra man accused of performing Nazi salutes in public and spreading extremist propaganda has been released on strict bail conditions after spending Christmas Day in custody.

title.children: Teenager accused of Nazi salutes granted bail in ACT court

image.altText: Close up of ladybugs

props.synopsis: When politicians and most staff are away for the summer holidays, a ravenous group of fly-in workers descend on Parliament House.

title.children: The 'voracious feeders' inside Parliament House

image.altText: Household plastic recycling

props.synopsis: Australia's first large-scale soft plastics recycling facility is processing huge loads each day, turning waste into a useful raw material.

title.children: Your soft plastic bags can once again be recycled. Here's how

image.altText: A woman at a computer with speech bubbles around her saying 'I've been really anxious lately' and 'What can I do about my mood?'

props.synopsis: Is it possible to make a "safe" AI therapy bot? We tested the limits of a new Australian-designed chatbot that's been carefully designed not to hallucinate or be your best friend.

title.children: What happened when we tested a new therapy chatbot

image.altText: The exterior of a Commonwealth Bank branchm including the brand's logos.

props.synopsis: The Commonwealth Bank persuaded a key regulator to delay announcing it had broken spam laws until after its AGM, new documents reveal.

title.children: Big bank convinced communications watchdog to delay revealing damaging news

image.altText: A man running.

props.synopsis: Police are looking for a man who allegedly tried to steal a woman's car in Richmond earlier this year but was foiled by bystanders, including one person wielding a golf club.

title.children: Bystanders fight off alleged Melbourne carjacker

image.altText: Jessica Cosgrove gestures with her hands while using Auslan

props.synopsis: Cochlear implants can be a life-changing tool for people with hearing loss, but some Deaf people argue their use risks compromising their community's identity.

title.children: Jessica could have a cochlear implant, but decided not to. Here's why

image.altText: A media pack surrounds mourners at Bondi Beach in the days after the terror attack.

props.synopsis: It was a year that bought us a federal election, ongoing war in the Middle East and Ukraine and a trial in a small Victorian town watched keenly around the world.

title.children: Looking back at the news that captured your attention in 2025

image.altText: helicopter hovering and emergency crews on a bush track

props.synopsis: A woman hiking on the NSW south coast survives being bitten twice by an eastern brown snake more than 2 metres long.

title.children: 'Incredibly lucky' bushwalker survives bite from giant brown snake

image.altText: sign along the Broome-Cape Leveque road

props.synopsis: Tropical Cyclone Hayley is upgraded to a category four system as it nears the northern WA coast.

title.children: Cyclone Hayley strengthens as it closes in on Kimberley coast

image.altText: A man photographed walking down the street

props.synopsis: Unlike his former bandmate John Lennon, Harrison survived the attack by a knife-wielding attacker, though Harrison's friends and family speculated it ultimately hastened his death less than two years later.

title.children: How history nearly repeated for a Beatle at the hands of a troubled fan

image.altText: A telescope on a hill, backlit by the Milky Way across the night sky.

props.synopsis: From dire wolves to dementia risk, this quiz will test your knowledge on some of the biggest science news stories of the year.

title.children: Quiz: Were you paying attention to the big scientific discoveries of 2025?

image.altText: composite image of Kerry Greenwood, Pope Francis and David Stratton

props.synopsis: From actors and designers to a Holocaust survivor and a broadcaster, these people made their mark.

title.children: Remembering the celebrities and public figures who died in 2025

image.altText: A woman with a serious expression studies a Bottlenose Wedgefish which is dead on a beach.

props.synopsis: Australian researchers are leading the way in the fight to protect a group of globally threatened fish species, which look like "a shark and ray joined together".

title.children: Australian researchers 'ringing alarm' on globally threatened rhino rays

image.altText: A large crack in a concrete slab.

props.synopsis: It is not unheard of for the ground to shake in Broken Hill, but what is unusual is the number of earthquakes recorded by Geoscience Australia this year.

title.children: Outback city rumbles through a record year of ground shaking

image.altText: car submerged in floodwaters

props.synopsis: North-west Queensland is on alert as flooding is expected to increase across northern parts of the state. The SES is sending additional crews to the outback amid flood rescues.

title.children: Flooding, heavy rain and damaging winds hit north Queensland

image.altText: Victoria Police

props.synopsis: A 15-year-old carrying a hunting knife was among more than 100 arrests during the first few weeks of a police operation at four of Melbourne's biggest shopping centres.

title.children: Police make 100 arrests during first weeks of Melbourne shopping centre operations

image.altText: An aerial shot of Wivenhoe Dam gates taken at sunrise

props.synopsis: South-east Queensland's largest water reservoir provides drinking water and protection from flooding. So, how does it all work?

title.children: Inside south-east Queensland's largest water reservoir Wivenhoe Dam

image.altText: A smiling Stella Thorbon standing near a lake with goats

props.synopsis: With bells tinkling, tails flicking, and panniers packed to the brim, adventurer Stella Thorbon has spent 26 days winding through the Victorian High Country with nine goats trotting faithfully behind her.

title.children: Stella leads 'goat squad' on hike through Victoria's High Country

image.altText: A man sitting in front of a poker machine. Two more poker machines are next to him.

props.synopsis: A researcher says data on gambling-related suicides underestimates the crisis "devastating people and families".

title.children: 'I didn't even know they gambled': An 'invisible' factor in suicide

image.altText: A Hobart Hurricanes T20 cricketer holds his bat above his head pointed down the ground in driving the ball.

props.synopsis: Matthew Wade's fuss-free cameo helps Hobart chase down the Melbourne Renegades's 163 at Bellerive Oval, lifting the Hurricanes well clear of the pack in second spot.

title.children: What a difference a Wade makes as Canes beat Renegades in BBL

image.altText: Merningar Barduk elder Lynette Knapp sits in a wheelchair surrounded by burnt bush.

props.synopsis: Elders on WA's south coast say they tried to warn the state government about unregistered cultural sites in the path of a prescribed burn, but the burn went ahead anyway.

title.children: Noongar elders say sacred site warnings were ignored before WA burn

image.altText: President Trump and President Zelenskyy shake hands in front of the US and Ukrainian flags.

props.synopsis: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has held talks with US President Donald Trump, and says he would prefer a commitment of 50 years.

title.children: US offers Ukraine 15-year security guarantee as part of peace plan

image.altText: Ahmed Al Ahmed in a white shirt, sitting for an interview

props.synopsis: Father-of-two Ahmed Al Ahmed, who risked his life to disarm one of the Bondi gunmen during a terrorist attack, says he feels sorry for the 15 people who were killed.

title.children: Bondi hero Ahmed Al Ahmed who wrestled gunman shares his story

image.altText: A man wearing a suit speaks in front of an Australian flag.

props.synopsis: The PM says a former head of ASIO will assess whether multiple security and law agencies worked as effectively as they should have before the attack.

title.children: PM announces terms for review of Bondi terror attack

image.altText: A curator talks to an official as they look at the pitch during a break in a cricket Test at the MCG.

props.synopsis: The ICC has handed down their verdict on the controversial MCG pitch which led to this year's Boxing Day Test wrapping up after just two days.

title.children: ICC hands down punishment for 'unsatisfactory' MCG pitch

image.altText: Emma Johnston smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: University of Melbourne vice-chancellor Emma Johnston has died from complications associated with cancer, aged 52.

title.children: Family, colleagues in 'disbelief' after leading scientist dies aged 52
